intro: Adyseton murale, commonly known as the wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found climbing on trees or shrubs. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Adyseton murale is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
